intro: Orbea baldratii subsp. baldratii, commonly known as the Natal orchid, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, typical of many flowering plants in the Apocynaceae family. Orbea baldratii subsp. baldratii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
